listitem.para: Currently our Epoch duration is hardcoded to 20 minutes. The docker test mix network uses an Epoch duration of 2 minutes and this setting is known a "warped epoch". In the future we'll make the Epoch duration configuration via bash environmental variable, see github issue: https://github.com/katzenpost/katzenpost/issues/744

section.title: CLI usage for directory authorities
section.para: The voting authority has the following commandline usage:
section.programlisting: ./voting -h Usage of ./voting: -f string Path to the authority config file. (default "katzenpost-authority.toml") -g Generate the keys and exit immediately.
section.para: The -g option is used to generate the public and private signing and link keys.

section.title: CLI usage for servers
section.para: The server commandline usage is as follows:
section.programlisting: ./server -h Usage of ./server: -f string Path to the server config file. (default "katzenpost.toml") -g Generate the keys and exit immediately.
section.para: The command output when generating keys looks like this:
section.programlisting: ./server -f my_katzenpost_mix_server.toml -g 22:51:55.377 NOTI server: Katzenpost is still pre-alpha. DO NOT DEPEND ON IT FOR STRONG SECURITY OR ANONYMITY. 22:51:55.377 NOTI server: AEZv5 implementation is hardware accelerated. 22:51:55.377 NOTI server: Server identifier is: 'example.com' 22:51:55.379 NOTI server: Server identity public key is: 2628F87F2806048C95F060DA9CD3D8F9BE7550BFB9EE85F213381BC04C047650 22:51:55.379 NOTI server: Server link public key is: CCDC5C105E649D543DF1CF397A17638F812F95B7E572288F4602F8EC01EC4F3C
section.para: Note that if you choose to configure logging to a file one disk, you can implement log rotation by moving the log file and then sending the HUP to the authority server process. This will cause the daemon to rewrite the log file in the location specified by the config file.
